business.headline: From reforms, jobs to resilience: CEA's key messages before Budget 2026As policymakers finalise the Union Budget 2026, CEA V Anantha Nageswaran has shared key insights on how reforms, employment growth and economic resilience can keep India on a steady path.

Why is the Economic Survey talking about junk food, social media restrictions?An economic survey is mostly about GDP growth and projections. So, why did the Economic Survey 2025-26 talk about rising junk food consumption, obesity and excessive screen time? Citing government data, Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran explained how poor physical and mental health among adolescents and working-age adults could weaken productivity and hurt India's long-term economic prospects.

Many jobs are immune to AI disruptions. Economic Survey lists themEven as Artificial Intelligence reshapes workplaces worldwide, the Economic Survey 2025-26 points to jobs that could be immune to AI disruptions. The survey has identified the kinds of jobs that technology is least likely to replace and explains why soft skills and hands-on expertise matter in an AI-driven economy.

From startups to scale-ups: What women entrepreneurs want from Budget 2026For many women entrepreneurs, the ask from Budget 2026 is clear: help them grow bigger. After years of startup-focused policies, they now want support that enables scale, competitiveness and long-term sustainability.

Sensex, Nifty close higher as Economic Survey lifts market mood ahead of BudgetThe Nifty 50 closed 0.3% higher at 25,418.90, while the BSE Sensex rose 0.27% to end at 82,566.37. Both indices recovered after falling around 0.8% earlier in the day, as buying returned in heavyweight stocks.

From inflation, AI to mental health: 6 key takeaways from CEA's Economic Survey briefingIndia's economic outlook is improving on several fronts, but fresh risks are also coming into focus. Speaking at the Economic Survey briefing, the CEA highlighted six key trends shaping growth, jobs, technology and mental well-being.

RTI reveals NITI Aayog has no research on long-term impact of 'Freebies'According to its annual reports, the think tank has completed 34 studies since 2022 and approved 32 new research studies during the same period, yet none relate to the fiscal sustainability or long-term economic consequences of state freebie schemes.

8th Pay Commission: Can employees expect a bigger pay hike this time?The 8th Pay Commission has raised hopes of a higher salary hike for central government employees and pensioners. With consumption slowing and incomes under pressure, expectations this time are higher than in the past.

Rupee sinks to lifetime low of Rs 92: Why is it falling again?The rupee's record low comes amid heavy foreign outflows, weak global cues, limited RBI intervention and delayed exporter inflows, leaving the currency stuck unless policy action or fresh foreign buying emerges.

Budget 2026: Jewellery industry pushes for GST cuts, duty relief and simpler rulesAs Budget 2026 approaches, India's jewellery industry is calling for lower taxes and simpler rules to boost demand, support jobs and bring more buyers back to the market.
Economic Survey 2026 pegs FY27 growth to be 6.8%–7.2%, higher than last yearIndia's economy expected to grow at 6.8%-7.2%, higher than last year's outlook: Economic Survey 2026

India–EU FTA: Why is the 'Mother of All Deals' India's global moment?At a time when protectionism and economic nationalism are resurging globally, the India–EU FTA demonstrates that large economies can still choose cooperation over confrontation. It reflects confidence in India's macroeconomic stability, regulatory predictability, and reform trajectory.

Indonesia's richest man loses nearly $9 billion in a day. Here's whyThe biggest loss was suffered by Prajogo Pangestu, Indonesia's richest person. His net worth fell by around $9 billion after shares of his energy and mining companies dropped sharply.

Gold crosses Rs 1.8 lakh, silver above Rs 4 lakh: 4 key reasons for the surgeThe unstoppable gold and silver rally has been fuelled by global uncertainty, strong demand and powerful technical momentum that have kept precious metals on an unbroken upward run.

Economic Survey 2026: What to expect and why it's importantThis year's Economic Survey comes at a time when the global environment remains unpredictable. Geopolitical tensions, volatile commodity prices, fluctuating interest rate expectations, and uneven global growth continue to influence economic outcomes for emerging markets.

Silver crosses Rs 4 lakh per kg: Here's what buyers should knowA major reason behind the spike is growing concern about a silver shortage. Global inventories have been tightening because demand from industries has grown faster than supply. Silver is used in solar panels, electric vehicles, electronics and high-tech manufacturing.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayAt 10:10 am, the Sensex was down 560 points, or 0.68%, at 81,784.28, and the Nifty fell 158 points to 25,184.30, slipping below key intraday support.

Economic Survey pointers: CEA flags skill gaps and structural risks in AI eraEconomic Survey Live Updates: The Economic Survey is an annual review of India's economy, looking at how the economy performed over the past year. It is prepared by the Department of Economic Affairs under the guidance of the Chief Economic Adviser and published by the Ministry of Finance.

Rupee slips to an all-time low of Rs 92 against dollar, declined 2% this yearThe rupee fell to 91.9850 against the dollar, crossing its previous all-time low of 91.9650 touched last week. This marked the first time the currency has moved so close to the 92 level.
Sensex, Nifty open lower ahead of Budget, rupee falls to all-time lowThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 275 points to 82,069.68, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48 points to 25,294.75 as of 9:25 am.

entertainment.headline: We all need you back: Gadar director Anil Sharma to Arijit Singh Filmmaker Anil Sharma urged Arijit Singh to reconsider his decision to step away from playback singing, calling him a true genius whose voice the industry still needs.

Mona Singh says playing Aamir Khan's mother in Laal Singh Chaddha changed her career Mona Singh said playing Aamir Khan's mother in Laal Singh Chaddha changed how the industry viewed her and opened doors to diverse roles.

Prabhas's Fauzi targeting Dasara release window: Reports The makers of the upcoming film Fauji are reportedly planning to release the Prabhas-starrer during the Dasara festival 2026, with production moving forward on a continuous schedule.

Dhurandhar OTT release: When and where to watch Ranveer Singh's spy thriller After a record-breaking theatrical run, Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar is set to stream on Netflix from January 30. The spy thriller crossed Rs 1000 crore in India, making it one of the biggest Bollywood hits ever.

Shruti Haasan joins Dulquer Salmaan's Aakasamlo Oka Tara, poster out now Shruti Haasan has officially joined the cast of Aakasamlo Oka Tara, a Telugu drama featuring Dulquer Salmaan. The film's character reveal poster is out now.

Did Zayn Malik just throw shade at Harry Styles' sky-high concert ticket prices? Zayn Malik's on-stage remark about concert ticket prices sparks discussion among fans, as controversy grows around high costs for Harry Styles' upcoming shows and reactions circulate online.

Did you know Aishwarya Rai was paid Rs 5,000 for ads before she shot up to fame? Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's journey to stardom began with her first three advertisements for just Rs 5,000, a phase recently recalled by producer Shailendra Singh.

Bridgerton stars Luke Thompson, Yerin Ha wish to visit India. Check out the reason Bridgerton season 4 focused on Benedict and Sophie's slow-building romance. The series highlights love as a blend of effort, choice, and emotional growth.

K-soap stars Park Seo Joon, Jung Yu Mi and Choi Woo Shik in new show Park Seo Joon, Jung Yu Mi and Choi Woo Shik are confirmed to appear in producing director Na Young Suk's new variety show, expected to air on tvN in the first half of this year. Filming is set to begin in February within South Korea, with further details about the show's concept and schedule yet to be announced.

Dhanush's upcoming D55 update: Sai Abhyankkar to compose music for film Sai Abhyankkar has been confirmed as the music composer for D55, the upcoming film featuring Dhanush and directed by Rajkumar Periyasamy.

Pulkit Samrat calls his boxer role in Glory intense yet addictive Pulkit Samrat said playing a boxer in Netflix's Glory was an "intense, yet addictive" experience as he makes his OTT debut as a lead actor.

Amid Border 2 success, Sunny Deol shares heartfelt thank you in video from hills Sunny Deol shared a warm video from the hills, thanking fans for the love shown to Border 2. The war drama earlier crossed Rs 200 crore at the box office in just six days.

Suniel Shetty explains why he won't watch son Ahan in Border 2 yet Suniel Shetty has expressed pride in his son Ahan Shetty's role in Border 2, choosing to wait until the film reaches a global Rs 500 crore collection before watching it, while the film continues its strong box office run.

As Arijit Singh quits playback, Vishal Dadlani shares post about success and peace Vishal Dadlani shared a life lesson on Instagram, reminding fans that success, money, and power do not guarantee peace or contentment.

John Abraham's new look worries fans: Is he ill? Actor John Abraham's latest clean-shaven look has led to a flurry of reactions on social media, with fans expressing surprise and speculating about his new appearance.

Is Prabhas's Salaar 2 still on? Makers share hint amid shelving rumours The production team behind Prabhas's Salaar: Part 1 – Ceasefire addressed speculation over the sequel's status by posting a behind-the-scenes photo on social media, confirming that the second part has not been shelved.

Hot Spot 2 Much director on controversial scene: Criticise film, not my expression Director Vignesh Karthick addressed social media backlash over controversial scenes depicting mansplaining scenes in Hotspot 2 Much, defending his creative choices and commenting on the responsibilities of filmmakers.

Varun Dhawan suffered tailbone fracture during Border 2 battle scene, shares ordeal Varun Dhawan reveals he suffered a tailbone fracture while shooting an intense battle sequence for Border 2. The actor says the injury, though painful, made his journey on the film unforgettable.

Aditi Rao Hydari calls Gandhi Talks a film where emotions speak without words Aditi Rao Hydari highlighted the emotional power of silence in Gandhi Talks, calling it a film where feelings speak louder than words.

general news.headline: Trump says US will open Venezuela airspace by day end, Americans can visit soonUS President Donald Trump said he had instructed US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy and military officials to open Venezuela's airspace by the end of the day. He further said that major American oil corporations would be flying in to scout locations.

How should PM Modi respond if Trump doesn't lower tariffs? What India thinksA majority of Indians have batted for reciprocal duties on US goods if Trump doesn't lower the tariffs anytime soon, according to the latest India Today-CVoter Mood of the Nation survey.

Modi wave intact, 350+ seats for NDA if Lok Sabha polls held today: MOTNThe India Today-CVoter Mood of the Nation survey has found that the NDA would continue its strong show and win 352 seats if the Lok Sabha elections were held today. The numbers show that the trust of the voters in PM Modi remains intact despite the geopolitical tensions brought about by a mercurial Donald Trump.

Humiliated by Trump, Canada and EU strike back with IndiaAmid Trump's confrontational diplomacy and hostile trade policies, Europe and Canada have pivoted towards India, a more reliable and stable partner, to diversify their exports. Here's a look at how a number of countries are now thumbing their nose at the mercurial Trump.

Miranda House, DRDO develop Made-in-India chip that warns soldiers of heart attacksMiranda House developed a prototype BioFET sensor with DRDO to detect early cardiac risk. Professor Monika Tomar said the device can measure three biomarkers from a blood sample to give timely alerts.

Trinamool or BJP: Who would Bengal choose if polls were held today?According to the India Today-CVoter Mood of the Nation survey, the Trinamool Congress's tally is projected to dip slightly, while the BJP is expected to marginally increase its seat share if Lok Sabha elections were held today.

Ajit Pawar plane crash: Black box in custody, Centre promises time-bound probeIn his reply to Devendra Fadnavis, Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu Kinjarapu assured the Maharashtra Chief Minister that his ministry has begun the probe and that it will be conducted in a transparent and time-bound manner.

Indian-origin US cyber agency chief shared sensitive documents on ChatGPT: ReportMadhu Gottumukkala, the acting director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), shared contracting and cybersecurity-related materials with the AI platform last summer for work purposes.

Why is the Dzukou Valley fire spreading from Nagaland to Manipur?A massive wildfire in Dzukou Valley is spreading from Nagaland to Manipur's Mount Esii. Understand the science of the chimney effect and why dry bamboo is fuelling the blaze.

NCP to propose Sunetra as Maharashtra Deputy CM, may contest Ajit Pawar's seatA leadership tussle has erupted in the NCP after Ajit Pawar's death, with senior leaders rallying around Sunetra Pawar as a potential successor, as per sources.

RCB vs UP Warriorz LIVE Score: Mandhana, Grace Harris take RCB into finalsRCB vs UP Warriorz LIVE Score, WPL 2026: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have qualified for the final of the Women's Premier League 2026, following an eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz. Smriti Mandhana (54*) and Grace Harris (75) led their team's run chase from the front and helped RCB chase down 144 in 13.1 overs.

Many jobs are immune to AI disruptions. Economic Survey lists themEven as Artificial Intelligence reshapes workplaces worldwide, the Economic Survey 2025-26 points to jobs that could be immune to AI disruptions. The survey has identified the kinds of jobs that technology is least likely to replace and explains why soft skills and hands-on expertise matter in an AI-driven economy.

Injection, cryptic post, viral video: Mystery deepens in Rajasthan's Sadhvi deathNoted religious storyteller Sadhvi Prem Baisa died under mysterious circumstances in Rajasthan, prompting police to conduct a post-mortem and political leader Hanuman Beniwal has demanded a CBI probe.

What the EU leaders ate at Rashtrapati Bhavan: A Himalayan MenuPresident Droupadi Murmu hosted a grand dinner in honour of European Council President Antonio Costa and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. Some traditional Yak cheese, mushroom, millets, and more from the Himalayan belt was served and how!
University of Bath School of Management announces up to £3 million in scholarships, empowering future global leadersStrategic Scholarship Investment Aimed at Attracting Exceptional Talent Worldwide

Biting winter chill and dense fog to return to North India on FridayThe IMD warns that a biting winter chill will return tomorrow as temperatures plummet across North India. Dense to very dense fog is also expected to significantly reduce visibility in several states.

Travesty of UGC Campus Rules 2026: They turn a protective shield into a deadly swordIn India's grievance-fueled politics, a shield for the vulnerable morphs into a sword against others. The 2026 UGC Regulations exemplify this betrayal, weaponising campuses for likely selective targeting.

Dhurandhar OTT release: When and where to watch Ranveer Singh's spy thrillerAfter a record-breaking theatrical run, Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar is set to stream on Netflix from January 30. The spy thriller crossed Rs 1000 crore in India, making it one of the biggest Bollywood hits ever.

Reflects steady progress in challenging global environment: PM on Economic SurveyPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Economic Survey, saying it portrays a resilient Indian economy backed by strong macroeconomic fundamentals and steady growth even amid global uncertainties.

6-year-old girl raped in Delhi; 2 minor accused arrested, third abscondingInvestigators said three boys—aged 10, 13 and 16—allegedly lured the girl and sexually assaulted her. Two of them have been taken into custody, while a hunt is on to trace the third.

Supriya Sule beat Sunetra in Lok Sabha polls. Now, she's bhabhi's pillar in tragedySupriya Sule took on the role of a protector, guarding Sunetra Pawar, during the funeral of her cousin Ajit dada. The sisters-in-law presented a picture of unity, portraying that, regardless of the difference in their political ideologies, they are a family first.

82% Indians report no caste-based discrimination, finds surveyAs India debates caste discrimination once again aftert the new UGC (Promotion of  Equity in Higher Education Institutions) Regulation 2026, in courts, campuses, and politics, a large-scale Pew Research survey offers a quieter but crucial perspective: how people across castes and communities actually experience discrimination today.

Miami University: A Top U.S. Destination for Future Tech and Engineering LeadersMiami University Expands Opportunities for International Students Through Industry-Integrated Computer Science & Engineering Programs

Pregnant Delhi Police commando beaten to death with dumbbell by husband over dowryThe victim, identified as Kajal, was reportedly regularly assaulted by her husband Ankur and his family over dowry demands and was four months pregnant at the time of her death.

sports.headline: Don't disturb chetta: Suryakumar Yadav pokes fun at Sanju Samson on Trivandrum return IND vs NZ: Suryakumar Yadav poked fun at Sanju Samson as the Indian team arrived in Thiruvananthapuram ahead of the final game of the T20I series against New Zealand.

T20 World Cup will get the best out of Maxwell: Ricky Ponting Ricky Ponting believes Glenn Maxwell can rediscover his form at the T20 World Cup 2026.  Maxwell scored just 76 runs from eight innings in the Big Bash League 2025–26.

Captain Siraj claims four as Hyderabad dominate Chhattisgarh in Ranji Trophy Mohammed Siraj led from the front as Hyderabad captain with his four-wicket haul leading the way for Chhattisgarh to be bundled out on the opening day's play.

Saim Ayub shines as Pakistan finally beat Australia in a T20I after 2650 days Pakistan vs Australia, 1st T20I: An all-round performance from Saim Ayub helped Pakistan end a 2,650-day wait for a T20I win over Australia, sealing a 22-run victory at Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium.

Michael Nobbs, Australian hockey great and former India coach, dies after illness Former Australian hockey player Michael Nobbs, who coached the Indian men's team at the 2012 London Olympics, has died after a prolonged illness.

Track and field stars found guilty of betting on teammates at major tournaments German discus throwers Henrik Janssen and Steven Richter received three-month suspended bans, while French runner Aurore Fleury faces a six-month ban and a 3,000 Euros fine after admitting to betting on athletics events, in violation of World Athletics Integrity Code rules.

19-year-old Indian grandmaster, Divya Deshmukh set to make her debut in Norway Chess Indian Grandmaster Divya Deshmukh will make her maiden appearance at Norway Chess Women, becoming the youngest competitor in the tournament's recent history and joining a field that includes reigning champions and world-class rivals.

Air pollution forces Mumbai players to wear face masks in Ranji clash vs Delhi Mumbai's players were forced to wear face masks on Thursday to protect themselves from pollution caused by nearby construction on the opening day of their Ranji Trophy match against Delhi.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai is one of the most loved venues in Indian cricket. The Wankhede promises electrifying action every time players take the field. Wankhede can host up to 33,500 people.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Arun Jaitley Stadium, Delhi T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Built in the centre of New Delhi, the Arun Jaitley Stadium has always been a mixed bag in terms of facilities and aesthetics. However, no one can deny that the 55,000-strong crowd has made the games incredibly memorable in recent years.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Narendra Modi Stadium, AhmedabadT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad is the world's largest cricket stadium. With a capacity of over one lakh spectators, it has consistently hosted marquee events in the cricketing world.

T20 World Cup 2026 Venue: Eden Gardens, KolkataT20 World Cup 2026 Venue: The iconic Eden Gardens stadium in Kolkata, will host a total of 6 matches in the tournament. The stadium at the moment can host up to 68,000 people, but there are plans to expand its capacity to 1,00,000.

RCB vs UP Warriorz LIVE Score: Mandhana, Grace Harris take RCB into finalsRCB vs UP Warriorz LIVE Score, WPL 2026: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru have qualified for the final of the Women's Premier League 2026, following an eight-wicket victory over UP Warriorz. Smriti Mandhana (54*) and Grace Harris (75) led their team's run chase from the front and helped RCB chase down 144 in 13.1 overs.

Rybakina beats Pegula in nervy semi final to set up revenge clash with SabalenkaElena Rybakina advanced to the Australian Open 2026 final after a straight sets win over Jessica Pegula. She now faces world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka, aiming for revenge for her 2023 final defeat.

2036 Olympic bid: Why aquatics, rowing, cycling are key to India's medal plansAs India works behind the scenes on its bid to host the 2036 Olympics, infrastructure is not a major worry, with Ahmedabad appearing largely ready for the challenge. What officials are focusing on instead is a rethink of India's medal strategy, particularly in sports like aquatics and cycling.

EFI sends rape-accused member as coach to Jordan, Sports Ministry issues noticeEFI's decision to appoint rape-accused Tarsem Singh as coach for the upcoming Jordan qualifiers has triggered widespread outrage, further deepening the crisis surrounding the embattled federation. The Sports Ministry has now issued a show-cause notice to the Equestrian Federation of India (EFI).

Pakistan don't have the guts to boycott T20 World Cup 2026: Ajinkya RahaneAjinkya Rahane has made a strong statement on Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2026 boycott theatrics. Despite off-field drama, Pakistan are set to participate with flights already booked to Sri Lanka.

After handshake snub, Sabalenka thumps Svitolina to move into Australian Open finalAustralian Open 2026: Aryna Sabalenka took a crushing straight-set win over Elina Svitloina to secure her fourth consecutive finals appearance at the Australian Open.

Elina Svitolina skips handshake, pre-match photo vs Aryna Sabalenka at Aus Open semisElina Svitolina skipped the handshake and pre-match photo before her Australian Open semi-final against Aryna Sabalenka. The decision followed a familiar pattern shaped by politics, tension and recent history between the two players.

Sinhalese Sports Club in Sri Lanka gets floodlights ahead of T20 World CupThe Sinhalese Sports Club (SSC) has undergone a major upgrade ahead of the T20 World Cup, with the installation of floodlights marking a significant milestone in the club's 75-year history and making it the fifth international venue in Sri Lanka equipped to host day-night cricket.

Yuvraj drops bombshell on why he retired from cricket: Didn't feel respectedFormer India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has opened up about the reasons behind his decision to retire from cricket in June 2019. The former left-hander stepped away from international cricket and the Indian Premier League after being left out of India's squad for the ODI World Cup that year.

Watch: India's new T20 World Cup promo trolls greatest rivalry vs PakistanIndia's new T20 World Cup promo takes a cheeky swipe at Pakistan ahead of their February 15 clash. The Star Sports video plays up recent dominance as the rivalry heads to Colombo.

Ashwin hits back at social media troll over indirect attack claim: Spoke to ViratFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin responded to a social media troll who accused him of indirectly targeting Virat Kohli during his analysis of India's third T20I win over New Zealand in Guwahati.

Semi-final Highlights: Elena Rybakina to meet Aryna Sabalenka in finalAustralian Open Live, Women's Singles semi-final: Elena Rybakina edged a tense semifinal against Jessica Pegula, winning 6-3, 7-6(7) after a dramatic second-set tiebreak to book her place in the Australian Open final. She is set to meet the top-seed, Aryna Sabalenka for the title.

Cricket nomads: Meet the jersey sellers who travel India match by matchBehind the billion-dollar world of official kits, a nomadic tribe of sellers follows the cricket calendar by rail. Travelling from Bihar, Mumbai and Kolkata to the rest of the country, these daily-wage labourers clothe the masses, navigating thin margins and brand crackdowns to keep the stadium blue.

ICC suspends USA batter on corruption charges right ahead of T20 World CupUSA batter and former captain Aaron Jones has been suspended after facing match-fixing charges. The ICC says the case is part of a wider investigation, putting Jones' T20 World Cup future in doubt.USA cricket's World Cup preparations.

Rohit Sharma points out India's biggest challenge going into the T20 World CupFormer India captain Rohit Sharma has pointed out India's biggest challenge going into the T20 World Cup. Rohit has said that India need to get their combinations right in the tournament.

Abhishek Sharma and the T20 World Cup risk: Ajinkya Rahane warns India battersAjinkya Rahane feels Abhishek Sharma's high-risk style will force India's batters to take responsibility. Despite the Vizag loss, Rahane believes such intent will better prepare India for T20 World Cup pressure.

UCL: Lamine praises resilient Barcelona as team finishes top 5 in league phaseChampions League: Barcelona's Lamine Yamal praised the team's resilient show on the final day of the league phase. Barcelona overturned a 0-1 deficit and beat Copenhagen 4-1 at Camp Nou.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
